Replace.Text: hurricane
hurricane
Hurricane
Pembroke
Royal Wealth

The mysterious, lovely and charming royal wealth is now in front of you! ...Oops? Startled? Don't worry, don't worry~ So where are we going next? The legendary coast where treasures are buried? Or the reefs full of wreckage? No matter where, let's hoist the sail and set off~
Pirates also have their own rules. Without rules, people’s hearts cannot be united.
Golden Deer

I caught you~ So, what do you want to know from the Golden Deer? Is it my name, eternal existence, or these cute tentacles~? Oh my, my tentacles have reached the end of the world... Oh~ It seems that there is no end of the world♪ Whatever~
I'm starting to get agitated and uneasy~
Strange Tides

Initially unlocks {LOC_TECH_CELESTIAL_NAVIGATION_NAME}, and builds port buildings with [ICON_PRODUCTION] +100% productivity. [NEWLINE]Units can enter ocean cells early, and units in water gain +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement at the start of the turn. [NEWLINE]Water cells with storms will gain random output. Units are immune to hurricanes, and hurricanes will occur more frequently.
Black Baronet

Naval units automatically form [ICON_CORPS] fleets/ [ICON_ARMY] armadas when they are promoted to the 2nd/4th time [ICON_PROMOTION]. [NEWLINE]All naval units can perform coastal plundering, and units are rewarded with a large amount of experience points for any plundering. [NEWLINE]After the first port area is built, plundering is strengthened, and coastal plundering does not consume [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement.
The Blessing of the Sea

Hurricanes double the output of civilization traits. [NEWLINE]Naval units can travel through any of your ports or coastal cities. [NEWLINE]All regions gain the standard adjacency bonus from adjacent coastal or lake tiles. Land regions adjacent to a coast provide +2 output of their own type to all water tiles in that city.
Port Royal

A Hurricane civilization district that replaces a port and costs less to build. [NEWLINE]This city can build one additional district. Triggers a cultural bomb on neutral territory. [NEWLINE]Each building built gives +100% adjacency bonus. [NEWLINE]If this city has a governor, its infrastructure is immune to natural disasters.
Sailing Home

Unique building for the Cyclone civilization. Does not replace any buildings. Unlocked in "{LOC_CIVIC_NAVAL_TRADITION_NAME}". [NEWLINE]Gives an [ICON_GOVERNOR] Governor title. Naval units produced by this city gain +60% experience. [NEWLINE]When built, this port district will provide [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to the adjacent bonus.
Sailing Ship

A unique naval unit of the Hurricane civilization, capable of coastal plundering. It cannot be produced and is only given when a port is built. [NEWLINE]After killing a unit, it has a chance to be captured. After having 1 [ICON_PROMOTION] promotion, it can build a city once in a valid coastal cell. [NEWLINE]After building all levels of buildings in the port for the first time, its [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength is +15.
+{1_Amount} [ICON_GOLD] Gold from a neighboring coast or lake ({LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_GRACE_OF_THE_SEA_NAME})
+{1_Amount} [ICON_FAITH] Faith from a neighboring coast or lake ({LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_GRACE_OF_THE_SEA_NAME})
+{1_Amount} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from an adjacent coast or lake ({LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_GRACE_OF_THE_SEA_NAME})
+{1_Amount} [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from adjacent coast or lake ({LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_GRACE_OF_THE_SEA_NAME})
+{1_Amount} [ICON_FOOD] Food from a neighboring coast or lake ({LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_GRACE_OF_THE_SEA_NAME})
+{1_Amount} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity from adjacent coast or lake ({LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_GRACE_OF_THE_SEA_NAME})
Pirate Discipline
+60% combat experience ({LOC_BUILDING_NAVIGATION_HOME_NAME})
Hijacking a ship
After defeating the enemy, there is a chance to capture him
Tidal Wave
The end of the golden age
Committed to conquering all coasts of the open ocean, likes civilizations with strong navies, and dislikes civilizations that do not develop their navies.
Drake Legend
Enjoys using navies to explore the world, and likes civilizations that do the same.
